metadata.synopsis: Dialog with the Gur Leader after you defeated Cazador
metadata.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book (Ctrl+Shift+7)Astarion - Origin Moments - Gur Follow-upWalk towards the Gur Leader

1.speaker: Ulma
1.text: You! There are spawn flooding out of that dungeon - what possessed you to release them?

19.speaker: Ulma
19.text: You! We ask you to free our children and you unleash thousands of vampire spawn on the Sword Coast?
19.context: InternalNodeContext: Released Spawns, got quest to kill Cazador

21.speaker: Player
21.text: They were innocent - it would've been wrong to kill them.

60.speaker: Ulma
60.text: I understand. Although I wonder how many other innocents will die for your mercy.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: They're in the Underdark, they won't bother you.

8.speaker: Ulma
8.text: I pray they will stay there. Although who knows what events this has set in motion.

110.speaker: Ulma
110.text: But you were given an impossible choice. Who's to say what path was right.

94.speaker: Ulma
94.text: We will make it our duty to find the spawn that escaped into the Underdark. Especially our children.

52.speaker: Ulma
52.text: I pray they can resist the urges of their new nature. But we shall see.

90.speaker: Ulma
90.text: As for your pale companion, we will hunt him no longer. Unless he gives us cause to.

44.speaker: Ulma
44.text: You have my people's thanks. There will be dark times ahead for us all, but we will stand with you as best we can.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Cazador's dead, your kids are free - that's what you asked for.

55.speaker: Ulma
55.text: However reluctantly, I cannot fault your logic. You did everything that was asked of you.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You'd prefer I killed your children?

64.speaker: Ulma
64.text: Of course not! I just wish - ... I do not know. I wish this had all passed us by.

30.speaker: Ulma
30.text: Hold there! Didn't expect to see anyone with a pulse coming out of that dungeon.
30.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("A stranger who faced down the Vampire Ascendant and lived.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

116.speaker: Ulma
116.text: My name's Ulma, my people are monster hunters. But the vampire Cazador made us his prey.
116.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("A stranger who faced down the Vampire Ascendant and lived.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

63.speaker: Ulma
63.text: He attacked us, stole our children, and left our tribe shattered.
63.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("A stranger who faced down the Vampire Ascendant and lived.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

82.speaker: Ulma
82.text: The few of us that survived came here looking for revenge. But what do we find instead?
82.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("A stranger who faced down the Vampire Ascendant and lived.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

29.speaker: Ulma
29.text: A stranger who faced down the Vampire Ascendant and lived.
29.context: NodeContext: can't believe you did that

51.speaker: Ulma
51.text: You, who destroyed the vampire lord, but released thousands of his spawn?
51.context: NodeContext: can't believe you did that

96.speaker: Ulma
96.text: Cazador and his spawn dead. And our children with them.
96.context: NodeContext: Bitter about the death of their children

38.speaker: Ulma
38.text: We meet again. A pity we had to meet like this.
38.context: InternalNodeContext: Astarion Ascended and we met Gur, but we didn't receive the quest.

43.speaker: Ulma
43.text: You could have stopped Astarion. You could have saved our children. Instead?
43.context: NodeContext: Next line: "one blood-sucking beast replaced with another."

112.speaker: Ulma
112.text: One blood-sucking beast replaced with another. Our children sacrificed to birth a monster.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: You don't understand, Astarion needed to do this.

70.speaker: Ulma
70.text: I understand perfectly. I have never seen anything so clearly.

23.speaker: Ulma
23.text: You are as monstrous as him. Perhaps more so, because you choose this path.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: You won't win this fight, but you can still walk away with your lives.

84.speaker: Ulma
84.text: There is no walking away from this. There is no hiding from the evil you have unleashed.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Your children were vampire spawn - they were already dead.

12.speaker: Ulma
12.text: Do not use our tragedy to justify your sins!

26.speaker: Ulma
26.text: We will find your vampire and end his blight on this land. But first, we deal with you.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Don't worry, you'll join your children soon.

47.speaker: Ulma
47.text: At last, we see you as the monster you are.

46.speaker: Ulma
46.text: You leave with your work half done? Cazador may be dead, but you would leave thousands of spawn trapped in those cages?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Killing his spawn means killing your children.

45.speaker: Ulma
45.text: Perhaps you were right to leave things as you did. We should finish this ourselves.

101.speaker: Ulma
101.text: Thank you for giving us this choice. For giving us a chance to see them one last time.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I took care of the vampire. I'm sure you can handle his spawn without me.

88.speaker: Ulma
88.text: Very well, we will do what needs to be done.

28.speaker: Ulma
28.text: As for our children... we shall see what can be done.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: You deal with it. Surely you can manage that.

59.speaker: Ulma
59.text: We sent you here on a mission of mercy, and what do we find?
59.context: InternalNodeContext: Astarion Ascended, we got the quest to kill Cazador

79.speaker: Ulma
79.text: So, is it true? You killed Cazador and all of his prisoners? Including the children he took from us?
79.context: InternalNodeContext: Spawns Dead, don't know about Children, met Ulma

115.speaker: Player
115.text: If your children were vampire spawn, they were dead long before I got there.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I'm sorry, I didn't know your children were in those cells.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Peace was the best I could give them. I'm sorry I couldn't do more.

39.speaker: Ulma
39.text: Alas, you may be right. You had few choices, all bad.

89.speaker: Ulma
89.text: Alas, you may be right. You had few choices, all bad.

56.speaker: Ulma
56.text: You did the best you could in an impossible situation. No one could ask for more.

75.speaker: Ulma
75.text: That leaves only the matter of your pale companion.

81.speaker: Ulma
81.text: His sins against us are great. But so too are the deeds you have done today.

73.speaker: Ulma
73.text: Tell Astarion he is free. Never again will he be hunted by my people.

69.speaker: Ulma
69.text: And be clear that he owes it all to you.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Thank you, I only want to live in peace.

40.speaker: Ulma
40.text: I fear none of us will see peace yet. There are still trials ahead.

66.speaker: Ulma
66.text: But you have my people's thanks - when it is time for you to face those trials, we will stand with you.

14.speaker: Ulma
14.text: Until then, go in peace. And thank you.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: For what it's worth, I'm sorry. I wish I could bring your children back.

10.speaker: Ulma
10.text: You gave them peace. For that, for all you have done, you have our thanks.

108.speaker: Ulma
108.text: I know you face trials ahead. But when it is time, you will not face them alone. We will stand with you as best we can.

76.speaker: Ulma
76.text: We offer no gold, but we do give you a promise.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: And I hope I never see any of you again.

6.speaker: Ulma
6.text: I would not be so hasty. You have trials still to face - you may want allies.

72.speaker: Ulma
72.text: If such a time comes, if you need help, we will stand with you.

22.text: That was not your choice to make! If nothing else we could have said goodbye.

50.speaker: Ulma
50.text: That was not your choice to make! If nothing else we could have said goodbye.

15.speaker: Ulma
15.text: Our children have been twice taken from us: first by the vampire spawn and now by you. But they will be avenged.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Your children were vampire spawn - they were dead long before I got there.

48.speaker: Ulma
48.text: They were our little ones! If nothing else, we could have said goodbye.

5.text: They were our little ones! If nothing else, we could have said goodbye.

106.speaker: Ulma
106.text: They were our little ones! If nothing else, we could have said goodbye.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I killed seven thousand monsters today, I can kill a few ungrateful hunters too.

58.speaker: Ulma
58.text: None of us need resort to harsh words. We are still friends here.

9.speaker: Ulma
9.text: None of us need resort to harsh words. We are still friends here.

119.text: We fight against evil wherever we find it. And I find it standing before me now.

74.speaker: Ulma
74.text: We fight against evil wherever we find it. And I find it standing before me now.

86.speaker: Ulma
86.text: I admit, I was not sure I would ever see you again. But you faced down the Vampire Ascendant and lived.
86.context: InternalNodeContext: Cazador Ascended, we met Ulma

7.speaker: Ulma
7.text: I cannot say if I'm more impressed by your bravery or your terrible luck to face such a foe.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Let's go with the first one.

105.speaker: Ulma
105.text: A pity such an impressive feat came on the heels of our children's tragedy, but you were not responsible for their deaths.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I'm sorry, but I couldn't save your children.

33.speaker: Ulma
33.text: As are we all but this is the hand fate has dealt. We will carry them in our hearts.

103.speaker: Ulma
103.text: I notice your pale companion's absence, but tell him he need not fear us.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I took care of Cazador, so I assume you'll leave Astarion alone now?

31.speaker: Ulma
31.text: Yes, you can tell your pale companion he has nothing to fear.

49.speaker: Ulma
49.text: With his old master dead and our children at rest, we will pursue him no more.

57.speaker: Ulma
57.text: Unless he gives us reason to.

100.speaker: Ulma
100.text: As for you, you have my people's thanks. I know you face trials ahead - we will stand with you as best we can.

113.speaker: Ulma
113.text: Until then, go in peace. And thank you.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: It was nothing, I'm surprised he beat you so badly.

16.speaker: Ulma
16.text: The beast is dead and that is what matters. Our children are avenged, if nothing else.

98.speaker: Ulma
98.text: So, is it true? Cazador is dead by your hand, and so are our children?
98.context: InternalNodeContext: Spawns Dead, knows about children
